html:
** Shares of the world's largest payment processor V.N down 1% pre-market at $213.1

** Amazon.com Inc AMZN.O said it would stop accepting Visa credit cards issued in the United Kingdom from next year due to the high transaction fees charged (Full Story)

** Amazon customers can still use Visa debit cards, Mastercard and Amex credit cards, and Eurocard

** U.S. supermarket chain Kroger KR.N in 2019 had said its Smith's Food and Drug Stores division will stop accepting Visa credit cards, while its Foods Co unit stopped accepting payments in 2018, citing higher transaction fees

** As of Tuesday's close, stock trades around 3.5% below its 50-day moving avg (DMA) of $222.93 and around 4.9% away from its 200-DMA of $226.16, a technical indicator for a bearish trend

** Technical charts also show a death cross, which occurs when the short term price average (50-DMA) falls below the long term price average (200-DMA)

** Stock down 1.6% YTD


(Reporting by Shashank Nayar in Bengaluru)

(( Shashank.Nayar@thomsonreuters.com ; within U.S. +1 646 223 8780; outside U.S. +91 80 6182 2256; ))
